intro: Kuestera aurantiaca, commonly known as the orange kuestera, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its roots are often harvested for their peppery flavor and use in culinary applications. Kuestera aurantiaca thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
